quote: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Nobody can hurt me without my permission.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: God has no religion.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Hate the sin, love the sinner.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Earth provides enough to satisfy every man's needs, but not every man's greed.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: To believe in something, and not to live it, is dishonest.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear to them except in the form of bread.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Whatever you do will be insignificant, but it is very important that you do it.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The day the power of love overrules the love of power, the world will know peace.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Truth never damages a cause that is just.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Whenever you are confronted with an opponent. Conquer him with love.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Action expresses priorities.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: You don't know who is important to you until you actually lose them.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: You can chain me, you can torture me, you can even destroy this body, but you will never imprison my mind.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: If I had no sense of humor, I would long ago have committed suicide.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: You may never know what results come of your actions, but if you do nothing, there will be no results.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: There is more to life than simply increasing its speed.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: I offer you peace. I offer you love. I offer you friendship. I see your beauty. I hear your need. I feel your feelings.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Love is the strongest force the world possesses and yet it is the humblest imaginable.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The simplest acts of kindness are by far more powerful then a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Silence becomes cowardice when occasion demands speaking out the whole truth and acting accordingly.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: There is nothing that wastes the body like worry, and one who has any faith in God should be ashamed to worry about anything whatsoever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: They cannot take away our self respect if we do not give it to them.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: A coward is incapable of exhibiting love; it is the prerogative of the brave.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: In a gentle way, you can shake the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Speak only if it improves upon the silence.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: To my mind, the life of a lamb is no less precious than that of a human being.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: In doing something, do it with love or never do it at all.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: I call him religious who understands the suffering of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Poverty is the worst form of violence.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You can never be overdressed or overeducated.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Never love anyone who treats you like you're ordinary.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A good friend will always stab you in the front.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I don't want to go to heaven. None of my friends are there.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You will always be fond of me. I represent to you all the sins you never had the courage to commit.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Hearts are made to be broken.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Experience is merely the name men gave to their mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You don't love someone for their looks, or their clothes, or for their fancy car, but because they sing a song only you can hear.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The very essence of romance is uncertainty.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: With freedom, flowers, books, and the moon, who could not be perfectly happy?
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: To define is to limit.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I don't want to be at the mercy of my emotions. I want to use them, to enjoy them, and to dominate them.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I can resist anything except temptation.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Nowadays people know the price of everything and the value of nothing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Dream is not that which you see while sleeping it is something that does not let you sleep.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: It Is Very Easy To Defeat Someone, But It Is Very Hard To Win Someone
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: All Birds find shelter during a rain.But Eagle avoids rain by flying above the Clouds.Problems are common, but attitude makes the difference!!!
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Dreams are not those which comes while we are sleeping, but dreams are those when u don't sleep before fulfilling them.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Don't take rest after your first victory because if you fail in second, more lips are waiting to say that your first victory was just luck.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: For great men, religion is a way of making friends; small people make religion a fighting tool.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: suffering is the essence of success!!!
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Thinking is the capital, Enterprise is the way, Hard Work is the solution
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Dream is not the thing you see in sleep but is that thing that doesn't let you sleep.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Man needs difficulties in life because they are necessary to enjoy the success.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Thinking should become your capital asset, no matter whatever ups and downs you come across in your life.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Sometimes, it's better to bunk a class and enjoy with friends, because now, when I look back, marks never make me laugh, but memories do.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Be active! Take on responsibility! Work for the things you believe in. If you do not, you are surrendering your fate to others.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: I am not handsome but I can give my hand to someone who need help... Because beauty is required in heart not in face....
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Once your mind stretches to a new level it never goes back to its original dimension
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: We are all born with a divine fire in us. Our efforts should be to give wings to this fire and fill the world with the glow of its goodness.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Let not thy winged days be spent in vain. Whenonce gone no gold can buy them back again.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Behind the parents stands the school, and behind the teacher the home.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: To succeed in life and achieve results, you must understand and master three mighty forces— desire, belief, and expectation.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: If you want to leave your footprints On the sands of time Do not drag your feet.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: The best brains of the nation may be found on the last benches of the classroom.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: God, our Creator, has stored within our minds and personalities, great potential strength and ability. Prayer helps us to tap and develop these powers.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Let not thy winged days be spent in vain. When once gone no gold can buy them back again.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: A big shot is a little shot who keeps on shooting, so keep trying.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: Adversity always presents opportunities for introspection.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: God has not promised Skies always blue, Flower-strewn pathways All our life through; God has not promised Sun without rain, Joy without sorrow, Peace without pain.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: He who knows others is learned, but the wise one is the one who knows himself. Learning without wisdom is of no use.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

quote: One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Most people do not really want freedom, because freedom involves responsibility, and most people are frightened of responsibility.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Unexpressed emotions will never die. They are buried alive and will come forth later in uglier ways.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: We are never so defenseless against suffering as when we love.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Out of your vulnerabilities will come your strength.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Where does a thought go when it's forgotten?
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Religion is an illusion and it derives its strength from the fact that it falls in with our instinctual desires.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: The virtuous man contents himself with dreaming that which the wicked man does in actual life.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Where the questions of religion are concerned people are guilty of every possible kind of insincerity and intellectual misdemeanor.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: He does not believe that does not live according to his belief.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: It is that we are never so defenseless against suffering as when we love, never so helplessly unhappy as when we have lost our loved object or its love.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Neurotics complain of their illness, but they make the most of it, and when it comes to taking it away from them they will defend it like a lioness her young.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Beauty has no obvious use; nor is there any clear cultural necessity for it. Yet civilization could not do without it.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: My love is something valuable to me which I ought not to throw away without reflection.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: The intention that man should be happy is not in the plan of Creation.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Men are more moral than they think and far more immoral than they can imagine.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Love and work are the cornerstones of our humanness.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings.
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: A true artist is not one who is inspired, but one who inspires others.
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: Surrealism is destructive, but it destroys only what it considers to be shackles limiting our vision.
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: The sole difference between myself and a madman is the fact that I am not mad!
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: Take me, I am the drug; take me, I am hallucinogenic
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: The thermometer of success is merely the jealousy of the malcontents.
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: The first man to compare the cheeks of a young woman to a rose was obviously a poet; the first to repeat it was possibly an idiot.
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: It is not necessary for the public to know whether I am joking or whether I am serious, just as it is not necessary for me to know it myself.
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: Mistakes are almost always of a sacred nature. Never try to correct them. On the contrary: rationalize them, understand them thoroughly. After that, it will be possible for you to sublimate them.
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: Everything alters me, but nothing changes me.
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: Let my enemies devour each other
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: The secret of my influence has always been that it remained secret.
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: Get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

quote: Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.
author: Stephen King

quote: Good books don't give up all their secrets at once.
author: Stephen King

quote: Fiction is the truth inside the lie.
author: Stephen King

quote: The road to hell is paved with adverbs.
author: Stephen King

quote: The scariest moment is always just before you start.
author: Stephen King

quote: If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot.
author: Stephen King

quote: you can, you should, and if you’re brave enough to start, you will.
author: Stephen King

quote: Alone. Yes, that's the key word, the most awful word in the English tongue. Murder doesn't hold a candle to it and hell is only a poor synonym.
author: Stephen King

quote: Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Poetry is the spontaneous overflow of powerful feelings: it takes its origin from emotion recollected in tranquility.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Nature never did betray; The heart that loved her.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Come forth into the light of things, Let Nature be your teacher.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: With an eye made quiet by the power of harmony, and the deep power of joy, we see into the life of things.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: There is a comfort in the strength of love; 'Twill make a thing endurable, which else would overset the brain, or break the heart.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Make it a rule never to give a child a book you would not read yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Youth is wasted on the young.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton, you may as well make it dance.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: There is no love sincerer than the love of food.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The liar's punishment is, not in the least that he is not believed, but that he cannot believe anyone else.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Never wrestle with pigs. You both get dirty and the pig likes it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: You use a glass mirror to see your face; you use works of art to see your soul.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: He knows nothing; and he thinks he knows everything. That points clearly to a political career.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A pessimist is a man who thinks everybody is as nasty as himself, and hates them for it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Dancing is a perpendicular expression of a horizontal desire.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: My way of joking is to tell the truth. It's the funniest joke in the world.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: After all, the wrong road always leads somewhere.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The play was a great success, but audience was a dismal failure.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Hatred is the coward's revenge for being intimidated.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: I’m an atheist and I thank God for it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Both optimists and pessimists contribute to society. The optimist invents the aeroplane, the pessimist the parachute.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Better keep yourself clean and bright; you are the window through which you must see the world.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: When a man wants to murder a tiger he calls it sport; when a tiger wants to murder him he calls it ferocity.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: When a thing is funny, search it carefully for a hidden truth.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: All great truths begin as blasphemies.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: There are those that look at things the way they are, and ask why? I dream of things that never were, and ask why not?
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Without art, the crudeness of reality would make the world unbearable.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: I often quote myself. It adds spice to my conversation.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Life does not cease to be funny when people die any more than it ceases to be serious when people laugh.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The most tragic thing in the world is a man of genius who is not a man of honor.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A government which robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Criminals do not die by the hands of the law. They die by the hands of other men.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: We learn from experience that men never learn anything from experience.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Power does not corrupt men; fools, however, if they get into a position of power, corrupt power.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The power of accurate observation is commonly called cynicism by those who have not got it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I would rather walk with a friend in the dark, than alone in the light.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart
author: Helen Keller

quote: One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much
author: Helen Keller

quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Keep your face to the sun and you will never see the shadows.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The most pathetic person in the world is some one who has sight but no vision.
author: Helen Keller

quote: What we once enjoyed and deeply loved we can never lose, For all that we love deeply becomes a part of us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The highest result of education is tolerance
author: Helen Keller

quote: Never bend your head. Hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Science may have found a cure for most evils; but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all -- the apathy of human beings.
author: Helen Keller

quote: A bend in the road is not the end of the road…Unless you fail to make the turn.
author: Helen Keller

quote: We could never learn to be brave and patient if there were only joy in the world
author: Helen Keller

quote: Everything has its wonders, even darkness and silence, and I learn, whatever state I may be in, therein to be content
author: Helen Keller

quote: Happiness does not come from without, it comes from within
author: Helen Keller

quote: Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Face your deficiencies and acknowledge them; but do not let them master you. Let them teach you patience, sweetness, insight.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement
author: Helen Keller

quote: When we do the best that we can, we never know what miracle is wrought in our life, or in the life of another.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I believe that God is in me as the sun is in the colour and fragrance of a flower - the Light in my darkness, the Voice in my silence.
author: Helen Keller

quote: So long as you can sweeten another's pain, life is not in vain.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Life is a succesion of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid.
author: Jane Austen

quote: There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature.
author: Jane Austen

quote: A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment.
author: Jane Austen

quote: In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you.
author: Jane Austen

quote: I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal.
author: Jane Austen

quote: The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!
author: Jane Austen

quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Angry people are not always wise.
author: Jane Austen

quote: You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope...I have loved none but you.
author: Jane Austen

quote: I could easily forgive his pride, if he had not mortified mine.
author: Jane Austen

quote: I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve.
author: Jane Austen

quote: The Very first moment I beheld him, my heart was irrevocably gone.
author: Jane Austen

quote: It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Laugh as much as you choose, but you will not laugh me out of my opinion.
author: Jane Austen

quote: I have not the pleasure of understanding you.
author: Jane Austen

quote: I may have lost my heart, but not my self-control.
author: Jane Austen

quote: When I fall in love, it will be forever.
author: Jane Austen

quote: If I loved you less, I might be able to talk about it more.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Give a girl an education and introduce her properly into the world, and ten to one but she has the means of settling well, without further expense to anybody.
author: Jane Austen

quote: To be fond of dancing was a certain step towards falling in love
author: Jane Austen

quote: One thing you can't hide - is when you're crippled inside.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Pain insists upon being attended to. God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our consciences, but shouts in our pains. It is his megaphone to rouse a deaf world.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected.
author: Markus Zusak

quote: He does something to me, that boy. Every time. It’s his only detriment. He steps on my heart. He makes me cry.
author: Nick Hornby

quote: I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.
author: Nicole Krauss

quote: I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.
author: Augusten Burroughs

quote: So it’s true, when all is said and done, grief is the price we pay for love.
author: John Green

quote: I'll fight it. I'll fight it for you. Don't you worry about me, Hazel Grace. I'm okay. I'll find a way to hang around and annoy you for a long time.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: All of humanity's problems stem from man's inability to sit quietly in a room alone.
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: You're like a song that I heard when I was a little kid but forgot I knew until I heard it again.
author: Confucius

quote: The funniest people are the saddest ones
author: Confucius
